intro: Crocodeilanthe undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf hoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia, where it grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves that have a wavy margin. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with a distinctive star-shaped appearance. Crocodeilanthe undulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
